abstract: The move could be a sign that the marketplace is becoming resistant to the unfettered increase in the prices of cancer drugs over the last decade.
snippet: The move could be a sign that the marketplace is becoming resistant to the unfettered increase in the prices of cancer drugs over the last decade.
lead_paragraph: In an unusual move, a big drug company said on Thursday that it would effectively cut in half the price of a new cancer drug after a leading cancer center said it would not use the drug because it was too expensive.

headline.main: Sanofi Halves Price of Cancer Drug Zaltrap After Sloan-Kettering Rejection
headline.print_headline: Sanofi Halves Price of Cancer Drug Zaltrap After Sloan-Kettering Rejection
